intro: Landolphia florida var. leiantha, commonly known as the golden shower tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its striking, yellow, pendulous flowers that resemble small showers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers bloom in clusters and are pollinated primarily by insects, contributing to its ecological importance in its native habitat.
